metadata.synopsis: Richie Rich (Macaulay Culkin) has every toy any little boy could ever want, in addition to an adoring mother (Christine Ebersole) and father (Edward Herrmann). The one thing Richie doesn't have is friends. When his parents suddenly go missing, Richie suspects an executive (John Larroquette) in the family company is to blame. Setting out to solve the mystery, Richie hooks up with a group of kids who prove they just might fill the void in his life, while helping him save his folks.

reviews: Culkin looks really bored. Maybe because "Richie Rich" is so damn boring.
Plays on every kid's fantasy of being so wealthy that no one likes him.
It was fun for what it was...which is not very much, but hey...kids will get a kick out of it for all the fun gadgets.
Most of the time, Richie Rich is too busy oohing and ahhing over the junk that money can buy to relax and have a good time.
It's only worth dreaming, "If I Were a Rich Boy"...
There's absolutely nothing here you haven't seen before, and while some kids might be mildly entertained, they would probably be even happier just staying home.
Be careful about taking kids under 7 or 8 as it may scare them.
A spirited and fluffy kids' comedy.
The filmmakers seem to think of their movie as a fiduciary fable, but they're not quite sure about its moral.
What's sort of wonderful is the way this movie takes that old formula and makes it fresh and new, with actors who give it wit and charm.
